p: 34. We begin with ourselves because we alone understand significance. As we have said, the phenomenon in the phenomenological sense is being, i.e., how and as what something is significant. But this significance is always the significance of some thing. Therefore, as § 2 and §4 pointed out, we have to begin with the right thing and with the proper access to that thing. And in fact, the goal of this study—the intelligibility of being as it is in itself—has already prescribed the thing that we should start with, namely ourselves.
